intro: Lepidium ruderale var. spinescens, commonly known as the spiny cress, is a herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring erect, branched stems covered in fine, glandular hairs. The leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a peppery aroma when crushed. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant produces small, spherical fruits called siliques, which contain several seeds.
